item.description:
Group tour of Somerville Open Studio Event spectacular on May 4th.

Please note: This was updated on April 29, 2013 with a new map and details.

Park cars/get off Bust/T stop to meet at 11:30AM at Joy St Studios parking lot which is at 86 Joy Street Somerville, MA

Then we will do group introductions so you can meet your fellow art lover for 5 minutes.

Then I will explain what we will be doing the whole 6 hours, what to see and not see today, tips on maximizing your art loving experience, how this SOS art weekends all works  and pass out color maps. That will take 5-10 minutes.

11:45AM we will board the trolley across the street and tour the other studios all around Somerville, MA

If you come late there will be NO easy way to find us. We will not wait sorry.. So please come early I will be there ready to go at 11:45AM! We want to look at  and enjoy Art not wait for latecomers. Again Sorry

Getting around: During the event Trolley service is available 12 noon to 5:30PM to help visitors get around.

Note: I know for sure there is FREE parking at Joy Street Art Studios parking Lot, But you have to get there early. Its  BEST to Park there at 11:30AM to get free parking.

The PLAN,  which we will call it an SOS FUN Mission is to hit most of the hip fun cool Somerville Studios via the Trolley service the we can end at Joy Street Studio CO-OP/ Brick Bottom area last.

Somerville Open Studios (SOS): Visit Somerville's Diverse + Vibrant Arts Community. Over 400 artists in over 100 venues will open their homes and studios. During this free showcase for the arts, mid-career and emerging artists working across a broad spectrum of fine art styles and craft media including painting, photography, printmaking, sculpture, glass, fiber, jewelry, furniture and ceramics will exhibit their work to the public.

SOS Visitors will be treated to displays of art in both traditional + non-traditional spaces throughout the city. Come see how Somerville's artists and entrepreneurs have transformed garages, real estate agencies, salons, cocktail lounges, and churches into both impromptu and permanent art galleries. Plan your visit by picking up a copy of the Somerville Open Studios map.

Web link to SOS: http://www.somervilleopenstudios.org/artists/location.php   there are other pages you can also find links with Maps, MBTA info, parking even Directions.

·         Please please make sure you are at Joy St Studios 86 Joy St by 11:30AM!

·         We need to jump on the trolley on time at 11:45AM to start our long, but FUN ART day. All trolleys only go one way (One direction in a loop). 

·         We will NOT  stop all stops (but you can if you like). We will hit the MAIN Art Areas  except for Vernon which we will hit on Sunday and Joy Street which we will hit last on Saturday.

·         If there is any time left we will hit Brickbottom Art Studios (Brickbottom Artists 1 Fitchburg St) down the street from Joy St Studios too.

·         If you miss us at Joy Street then try to find us at the Washington Street studio or keep going in the Trolley loop till you find us.

·         Please  make sure everyone catches the last Trolley to Joy St around 5PM so you don’t get left behind!

 

Here is the order

 

Update offical SOS 2013 Social Fun meetup path!

Start at #108 (Joy St Studios 86 Joy St) park, meet the group do intros and pick up free Trolley stop #A.

Off Trolley stop #D, hit #98 (Washington Street Art Center 321 Washington St, for 20-25 minutes)

Then walk to #96 (Artisan's Asylum at10 Tyler St for 10 minutes). This is a newer Art Studio.

Walk to the Trolley stop #E, get on Trolley to get off  at Trolley stop #F (We might walk if trolley run late)

Hit #87 RED STAR highlighted on map called Somerville Museum (1 Westwood Rd). We will stay at the Somerville Museum Area for 15 minutes. This is where Artist have 1 sample of their art work. Please take the time to write down the number of those Artists that interest you. Then decide if you will stay with the group or do the rest on your own. Art is meant to be fun, so you don’t have to stick with us the whole time!

Don’t forget to visit the Artists around the surrounding areas to not just the Somerville Museum. Like #88 Central Street Studios (57 Central Street) (this is another 15 minute stop). Get on at Trolley Trolley stop #F or walk

Get off at Trolley stop #G  (or walk) to see  #61 (Arts at The Armory 191 Highland Avenue) for 25 minutes. Also Coffee /snack/bathroom break.

Get on at Trolley Trolley stop #G  and get off at Trolley stop #H and walk to #26. NOTE we are not getting off at Trolley stop J which is closer, because trolley will get stuck in traffix near Poerter SQ.

Walk to #26 Mix it Print Studio 32 Clifton St (15 minutes). This si a greta stop to relax outside and on the balcony on the 3rd floor.

Walk to Trolley stop #N  get on Trolley. Get off at Trolley stop #O  if Trolley is late we’ll walk it!

#23-  Blue Cloud Gallery (713 Broadway) for  color photographs and a special treat since Biagio has some of his art on display here. . Also, this will be a coffee/snack break area nearby.

Get on  at Trolley stop #O.  Get off at Trolley stop #Q.  

Walk down to #53 Skunk Skunkadelia 75 Bartlett St. #2 , has Robots, ray guns, rocket ships. Yes it’s a house full of fun and crazy cool bikers, but it’s my 2nd favorite stop of SOS!!! You will be amazed what in here, this is a must do for all!!!! (15 minute stop, due to walking)

Then walk back up Bartlett St., take a right onto Broadway and walk down to #78 Hilary Scott and his  Eclectic Sculpture (9 Browning Road)  Fantastic Machines & Creatures (it’s my 1st most favorite stop of SOS Must see)

Walk back to get on Trolley stop #Q (on Broadway). Get off at Trolley stop #S.  

Note: we Skipped #57 and #58 Vernon St Studios stops since we plan to come back here for 2-3 hours on Sunday (yes it is that big, over 10 Artist open here!) BUT NOTE: If you cannot go to Vernon St on Sunday then you should see Vernon St now on Saturday if you have time!

Trolley stop #S.  for  #82 (Gilman SQ) Mad Oyster Studios 2 Bradley St 23 Artists here. (25 minute stop)

Then walk to #83 Pearl Street Studios 226 Pearl Street  (nearby + 15 minute stop)

Back on the Trolley  at Trolley stop #S.  to end our day back at Trolley stop #A.

Enjoy #108 (Joy St Studios 86 Joy St) for 30 minute stop if you have any energy left.

Enjoy #109 Brickbottom Art Studios (1 Fitchburg St) down the street from Joy St Studios. By then you will pass out! lol

 

Disclaimer:  Please realize there are 400 Artist to see in all. This would take you about 80 hours to see and I’m trying to fit this into 8 hours over 2 day. If you get tired and need to rest we’ll understand, but we will not wait too for you. I’ll try you budget in some rest stops. Saturday is a long day 6 hour day so please wear comfy shoes (Sneakers) and be prepared to walk a lot  inside and outside!.... I realized we skip many of the cool, smaller Artists which sucks, but we only have time to see so many on Saturday. Plan on seeing Vernon St on Sunday for 2-3 hours and then if you have time hit the smaller Artists too. There is no set time for lunch,  we’ll play it by ear and I’ll listen  to any ideas, but it has to be quick lunch sorry. Lastly, take time to enjoy the art!
item.how_to_find_us: Meet at 11:30AM parking lots at 86 Joy Street Somerville, MA
item.name: Somerville Open Studio Part 1- Meet at Joy St for Grand Tour around Somerville
